topic.title: remote hosting of a peer.
topic.body: So I made a little website in local, but I would like to have a peer running 24/7 on a VPS I have. I instaled zeronet on the server but I have no graphical interface. I did try to wget 127.0.0.1:43110/1B__my hash bla bla bla__xZ and also curl But what I got is a html file saying (from both local and remote) : 'Your browser is not supported please use Chrome or Firefox.";' I also tried : ./ZeroNet.sh peerGetFile 1.my.ip.1 43110 1B__my hash bla bla bla__xZ index.html but it say 'ConnServer Internet offline' and crash (from both local and remote), What would be the good approach to this ?

topic.title: files_optional
topic.body:
from the doc here : 
https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/content_json/

it say:
"files_optional
Size and sha512 hash of optional files contained in your site. Automatically added by the command zeronet.py siteSign siteaddress privatekey.

Example:
    "data/myvideo.mp4": {
      "sha512": "538c09328aa52765443464135cef644c144346418378199fa5cef61837819538",
      "size": 832103
"

but how to tell ' zeronet.py siteSign siteaddress' wich files I want to be optional ?

topic.title: total site size limit
topic.body:
>    # Check total site size limit
>        if site_size > site_size_limit:
>           self.log.error("%s: Site too large %s > %s, aborting task..." % (inner_path, site_size, site_size_limit))
>            task = self.site.worker_manager.findTask(inner_path)
>            if task:  # Dont try to download from other peers
>                self.site.worker_manager.failTask(task)
>            return False




why that ? 
I can understand a file size limit but for the whole site ? Is there a reason for this ?

topic.title: How to query a file ?
topic.body:
Hi, I did a site with optional files, Now I want to do a ajax query to load files. 

But I receive: 
No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. Origin 'null' is therefore not allowed access.

So I googled and come across :
https://www.reddit.com/r/zeronet/comments/562mkm/can_zeronet_sites_load_individual_elements_from/

Wich was saying to use fileGet from the API

google lead me to :
https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/?highlight=fileGet

But sadly the 'doc' as is just a function name with 2 argunments and no javascript example :(  

I tried the function and it say: 
console.log(fileGet("folder/"+file))
Uncaught ReferenceError: fileGet is not defined(â€¦)


Idk what to do now...

topic.title: Removing hardcoded trackers and still be able to publish ?!?
topic.body:
- I deleted, ZeroNet/src/config.pyc 
- removed all hardcoded trackers from ZeroNet/src/config.py
 - maked shure ZeroNet/zeronet.conf have no trackers listed. 
 - Launched ZeroNet.sh with no arguments
 - port 15441 is closed
 - tor is down
 
And it's amazing im still able to push content and receive changes.  
Can someone explain why this is appening ? 

I wish my node could talk to ONLY ONE private tracker,  but I can't isolate it...

17_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN.body: I bet your problematic images are javascript loaded not in the html template, turn off your javascript in your browser and check if there is a concordance between what nojs broke and what httrack broke

Javascript could be weak and broke from the fact that httrack does not see the webpages as your server serve them. 

meanwhile, I see no broken links in your page. 
https://imgur.com/a/wtnmk

To make a correlation test as I suggested you lower, you need to turn your browser's javascript off to look at the site like httrack would have broke it. Correlations are not proofs, but it can give you a good idea of where to look for under 10 min.

>    for table_name, table_settings in self.schema["tables"].items():
>KeyError: 'tables'

> [pseudo](#comment_1_1FGjKJX4U11aJBK9vAq5cYWTrSajWhV6ef): If I open a site, does that mean i'm now hosting it as well?

yes, once it's loaded you start seeding it, But if you disagree with his content. You can go in your zeronet home page and put the problematic site on pause (where you will either receive updates from it or seed it) or completely delete it.

> [nofish](#comment_847_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Yes, it will create some tables, but you can ignore that, make tables: {}, so it will not bother it.

tables: {} work and fixed the truncating problem.

Hi, (me agan)
I want to include an optional .json dataset into the sqlite database.

First, without the "optional" in content.json.  The .json is getting into the sqlite db like it should and Im happy.

But, If I add the "optional" without changing anything else the data does not get included into database.(obv cuz it's not downloaded)

Then, If I use <script>zeronetApi.cmd('fileGet', ......) to query the json file. I can sucesfuly load&access the .json file content. But still, content does not get Imported into database. Witch make me sad. 

How can I tell zeronet "when this optional file is getting downloaded, add it to the sqlite db". ?

> [akraut](#comment_1_1JUG95g9ysj439uw4rGEwVhAzpVu6vRzxA):  "File Update Failed" 

It append when a user announce he have a new/updated file to distribute but disconnect before/while others peers are uploading it. There is nothing you can do about that. 

The error message is only informative, it's not a fatal error that break something.

(correct me senpai @nofish if im wrong)

> [akito](#comment_11_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): 

Like how to github ? :p If you are not familiar with github there is tons of tutorial and documentation about that. Nothing zeronet specific.

https://github.com/helloZeroNet/ZeroNet is a personal project not an organisation. So you need to fork the code do a commit, and send a pull request to the master branch I suppose.(testing seem quite outdated)

You can take a look here at the contributions guidelines but there is not much stuff.  https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/help_zeronet/contributing/

Also, 21 pull request are pending, make sure your bug have not been solved already.

> [rythyrix](#comment_76_18eGWSaM3Vc9i61LVfogjQJf5gp7EN7b9Y): 

That interresting, but I don't see any usecase where one would like to sign a file he don't have. How to know what you are signing?

> [rythyrix](#comment_79_18eGWSaM3Vc9i61LVfogjQJf5gp7EN7b9Y): Usecase? I think any time the node you are on doesn't have the content to sum. Hard drive failure comes to mind, or sudden power failure during write to FDE-encrypted drive. While this can be worked around if your zite was popular enough, lesser-known zites with lots of optional files may not have any other option. [...]

Im not sure to follow you. Im not sharing my private key with anyone, The node who sign the site is the node that have the original copy of content. If files are missing,  the files will be missing for everyone. I don't see how I would want to sign random hashes of files I don't have.

If I got HDD problems, and data are lost and can't be recovered from peers...... It's gone.... those files will never reapears. Next sign, they should be removed instead of causing missing files errors for eternity. 

 content.json file size limit It's an anoying arbritrary limitating rule. but meh, ill play with the rules. :D
